channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Meta burned $19 billion on VR last year, and 2026 won’t be any better
item.description: The reported financial losses follow a series of layoffs at the VR unit.

item.title: This Chinese Startup Wants to Build a New Brain-Computer Interface—No Implant Required
item.description: Gestala is the latest company to emerge from China’s burgeoning brain-computer interface industry. It plans to access the brain with noninvasive ultra...

item.title: 50% Off Blue Apron Promo Codes | February 2026
item.description: Browse chef-curated meal plans, plus get $25 off with an exclusive Blue Apron coupon code, plus 50% off your first 2 orders, and more top coupons on W...

item.title: 15% Off Dyson Promo Code | February 2026
item.description: Get 15% off with a Dyson coupon code, plus save up to $600 with discounts on vacuums, $150 off Airwraps, and more.

item.title: 30% Off Samsung Promo Code | February 2026
item.description: Save 30% or 10% with Samsung coupon codes, up to $1,000 on appliances, plus limited-time deals on the Galaxy Z Fold7, Flip7, and S25.

item.title: Deezer makes it easier for rival platforms to take a stance against AI-generated music
item.description: Last year, Deezer introduced an AI detection tool that automatically tags fully AI-generated music for listeners and removes it from algorithmic and e...

item.title: 50% Off DoorDash Promo Code | February 2026
item.description: Explore today’s top DoorDash promo codes for $25 off your first order, free delivery, and up to 50% off for existing customers.

item.title: Microsoft gained $7.6B from OpenAI last quarter
item.description: Microsoft, one of OpenAI's major investors, is benefiting greatly from the AI lab's growth.

item.title: Zuckerberg teases agentic commerce tools and major AI rollout in 2026
item.description: Mark Zuckerberg says 2026 will be "a big year for delivering personal super intelligence."

item.title: Trump energy department loosens rules on nuclear safety
item.description: The new rules apply to nuclear reactors built on Department of Energy property, which includes several currently being developed by startups.
